name: Great Hornbill
description: The Great Hornbill is a large bird with a prominent casque on its beak, known for its loud calls.
spread_note: Found in India, Southeast Asia, and parts of China.
food_note: Plays a key role in seed dispersal in forests.
proportions: Length: 95-130 cm, wingspan: up to 150 cm, weight: 2-4 kg.
reproduction: Females seal themselves in tree cavities to lay 1-2 eggs, incubation about 40 days.
attractions: Popular in zoos for their unique appearance and behaviors.
projects_note: Threatened by habitat loss; conservation programs focus on forest preservation.
breeding: Breeding in captivity is rare due to complex nesting needs.
